pageTitle: Itinerary for Monday, February 13, 2017 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Monday, February 13, 2017:

Ottawa, Ontario 

7:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will depart for Washington, D.C., United States of America
  
Canada Reception Centre (Hangar 11)
Macdonald-Cartier International Airport
Ottawa, Ontario

Notes for media:

  •  Photo opportunity for departure
  • Media should arrive no later than 6:00 a.m.


Washington, D.C., United States of America

9:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will arrive at Dulles International Airport, near Washington, D.C., United States of America.

Dulles International Airport
Loudoun County, Virginia
United States of America

Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity


10:50 a.m. The Prime Minister will arrive at the White House and be greeted by the President of the United States of America, Donald J. Trump.

West Wing
White House
Washington, D.C., United States of America

 Note for media:

  • Photo opportunity


11:10 a.m. The Prime Minister and the President of the United States will hold a tête-a-tête meeting.

Oval Office, West Wing
White House
Washington, D.C., United States of America

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity


11:25 a.m.  The Prime Minister will hold an expanded bilateral meeting with the President of the United States.

Oval Office, West Wing
White House
Washington, D.C., United States of America

Note for media:

  • Closed to media


12:15 p.m. The Prime Minister and the President of the United States will participate in a roundtable discussion with women executives. 
    
Cabinet Room, West Wing
White House
Washington, D.C., United States of America

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity


12:50 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend a luncheon given by the President of the United States.

Cabinet Room, West Wing
White House
Washington, D.C., United States of America

Note for media:

  • Closed to media


2:00 p.m. The Prime Minister and the President of the United States will hold a joint media availability.

East Room
White House
Washington, D.C., United States of America

Note for media:

  • Open media coverage


3:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the Speaker of the United States House of Representatives, Paul Ryan.

United States Capitol
Washington, D.C., United States of America

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity


3:40 p.m.  The Prime Minister will meet with the Senate Majority Leader, Mitch McConnell.

United States Capitol
Washington, D.C., United States of America

Note for media:

  • Pooled photo opportunity


6:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will depart for Ottawa, Canada.
